qas.question: Why were the researchers recognized in 1975?

answers.text: the saving of untold thousands of lives and the alleviation of the suffering of millions of victims of hypertension

plausible_answers.text: Karl H. Beyer, James M. Sprague, John E. Baer, and Frederick C. Novello of Merck and Co

qas.question: What is Ciba used to treat?
What was the main shortcoming in the drug Ciba?

context: In <a8_0>1952<a8_0/> <a0_0><b10_0>researchers at Ciba<b10_0/><a0_0/> discovered the first orally available vasodilator, <a5_0>hydralazine<a5_0/>. A major shortcoming of hydralazine monotherapy was that it <a4_0><b14_0>lost its effectiveness over time<b14_0/><a4_0/> (tachyphylaxis). In the mid-1950s <a2_0><b12_0>Karl H. Beyer, James M. Sprague, John E. Baer, and Frederick C. Novello of Merck and Co<b12_0/><a2_0/>. discovered and developed <a6_0>chlorothiazide<a6_0/>, which remains the most widely used antihypertensive drug today. This development was associated with a substantial decline in the mortality rate among people with <a3_0><a9_0>hypertension<a9_0/><a3_0/>. The inventors were recognized by a <a7_0>Public Health Lasker Award<a7_0/> in 1975 for "<a1_0><b11_0>the saving of untold thousands of lives and the alleviation of the suffering of millions of victims of <b13_0>hypertension<b13_0/><b11_0/><a1_0/>".
